question: ........ and isolated auxin from urine of a person suffering from Pellagra. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: ........ and isolated auxin from urine of a person suffering from Pellagra. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Kogl and H. Smit (1931) isolated auxin from human urine, specifically from a person suffering from pellagra (deficiency of Vitamin $B_{3}$).

question: Single maize root apical meristem gives rise to more than cells/hour EXCEPT. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Single maize root apical meristem gives rise to more than cells/hour EXCEPT. [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: A single maize root apical meristem can give rise to more than $17,500$ new cells per hour. Therefore, $12,500$ is the exception as it is less than the stated value.

question: The die-back disease in Citrus is due to deficiency of
question_latex: The die-back disease in Citrus is due to deficiency of
solution: Die-back of Citrus is caused by the deficiency of Copper ($Cu$). It results in the death of shoots starting from the tip.

question: The plant hormone produced by Rhizobium is
question_latex: The plant hormone produced by $Rhizobium$ is
solution: $Rhizobium$, a nitrogen-fixing bacterium, produces Indole-3-Acetic Acid ($IAA$), which stimulates root nodule formation in legumes.

question: Choose the incorrect pair.
question_latex: Choose the incorrect pair.
solution: Abscisic acid ($ABA$) is a growth inhibitor and stress hormone. The flowering hormone is typically referred to as 'Florigen'.

question: Which among the following represents the process of transamination? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which among the following represents the process of transamination? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Glutamic acid + oxaloacetic acid -> alpha ketoglutaric acid + Aspartic acid
B. Aspartic acid + $NH_{4}$ + ATP -> Aspargine + ADP
C. alpha ketoglutaric acid + $NH_{4}$ + $NADPH_{2}$ -> Glutamate + $H_{2}O$ + NADP
D. Glutamic acid + $NH_{4}$ + ATP -> alpha Glutamine + ADP
answer: A. Glutamic acid + oxaloacetic acid -> alpha ketoglutaric acid + Aspartic acid
solution: Transamination involves the transfer of an amino group from an amino acid to a keto group of a keto acid, catalyzed by transaminases.

question: The natural plant hormone isolated from corn kernels and coconut milk is
question_latex: The natural plant hormone isolated from corn kernels and coconut milk is
solution: Zeatin is a natural cytokinin first isolated from maize kernels ($Zea$ $mays$) and is also abundant in coconut milk.

question: Identify two physiological processes induced by two different phytohormones having a common precursor, which is formed due to the catalytic activity of pyruvic dehydrogenase complex. I. more female flowers in cucumber. II. alpha-amylase production in barley grain. III. Acceleration of fruit ripening in tomato. IV. Delay in sprouting of potato tubers.
question_latex: Identify two physiological processes induced by two different phytohormones having a common precursor, which is formed due to the catalytic activity of pyruvic dehydrogenase complex. I. more female flowers in cucumber. II. $\alpha$-amylase production in barley grain. III. Acceleration of fruit ripening in tomato. IV. Delay in sprouting of potato tubers.
solution: Both Ethylene (ripening) and Auxin (delaying sprouting) share Acetyl-CoA as a metabolic intersection or relate to pyruvate metabolism indirectly through their biosynthetic precursors.

question: Auxins promote
question_latex: Auxins promote
solution: Auxins regulate cell enlargement, stimulate vascular cambium activity, and maintain apical dominance by inhibiting lateral buds.

question: Which plants show flowering usually in winter and late summer? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which plants show flowering usually in winter and late summer? [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Short day and long day plants
solution: Short Day Plants ($SDPs$) require a photoperiod shorter than a critical length, which typically occurs during winter months.

question: Glutamic acid + oxaloacetic acid -> alpha ketoglutaric acid + Aspartic acid. Above reaction, during amino acid synthesis, represents [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Glutamic acid + oxaloacetic acid $\xrightarrow{\text{Aminotransferase}}$ $\alpha$ ketoglutaric acid + Aspartic acid. Above reaction, during amino acid synthesis, represents [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: This is a classic transamination reaction where the amino group is transferred from Glutamate to Oxaloacetate to form Aspartate.

question: Recalcitrant seeds mean the seeds with [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Recalcitrant seeds mean the seeds with [MHT-CET 2024]
options: C. high moisture content at certain level
D. reduced moisture content below certain level
answer: D. reduced moisture content below certain level
solution: Recalcitrant seeds are those that do not survive drying and freezing during ex-situ conservation; they die if moisture drops below a critical level.

question: Plant hormones are
question_latex: Plant hormones are
solution: Plant Growth Regulators ($PGRs$) include both promoters (auxins, GAs, cytokinins) and inhibitors ($ABA$, ethylene).

question: Cell elongation in internodal regions of the green plants takes place due to
question_latex: Cell elongation in internodal regions of the green plants takes place due to
solution: Gibberellins are primarily responsible for internodal elongation, a phenomenon often called 'bolting' in rosette plants.

question: Changes that occur during plant growth are [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Changes that occur during plant growth are [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Growth is defined as a permanent and irreversible increase in size, volume, or weight of an organ or its parts.

question: To induce early flowering in plants, pre-treatment of seeds or seedlings is done at ........ deg C temperature. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: To induce early flowering in plants, pre-treatment of seeds or seedlings is done at ........ $^{\circ}C$ temperature. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Vernalization is the process of inducing flowering by exposure to low temperatures, typically between $1^{\circ}C$ and $6^{\circ}C$.

question:
Which of the following statements are INCORRECT about exponential phase of plant growth?
I Phase of enlargement is called exponential phase.
II Cell in this phase are turgid due to absorption of water.
III Cells become vacuolated and osmotically active.
IV Growth rate is slow.
V Enlargement of cells occur lengthwise and breadthwise. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following statements are INCORRECT about exponential phase of plant growth? \\ I Phase of enlargement is called exponential phase. \\ II Cell in this phase are turgid due to absorption of water. \\ III Cells become vacuolated and osmotically active. \\ IV Growth rate is slow. \\ V Enlargement of cells occur lengthwise and breadthwise. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: C. II, IV and V only
D. I, II and III only
solution: In the exponential (log) phase, the growth rate is at its maximum (fastest), not slow.

question: Which pigment involves in photoperiodic change in plants?
question_latex: Which pigment involves in photoperiodic change in plants?
solution: Phytochrome is the blue-green pigment responsible for perceiving light and initiating photoperiodic responses.

question: Prunning of plants promotes branching because the axillary buds get sensitized to
question_latex: Prunning of plants promotes branching because the axillary buds get sensitized to
solution: Removing the shoot tip (auxin source) reduces apical dominance and allows cytokinins to promote axillary bud growth.

question: In plants, lower branches are larger than upper branches due to [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: In plants, lower branches are larger than upper branches due to [MHT-CET 2020]
options: A. Axillary buds near apical bud receive auxin in more concentration.
B. Lower axillary buds receive auxin in minute concentration.
C. Lower axillary buds receive auxin in more concentration.
D. Auxin formed in apical bud does not get transported towards lower axillary bugs.
answer: B. Lower axillary buds receive auxin in minute concentration.
solution: As auxin concentration decreases down the stem, the inhibitory effect on axillary buds is lessened, allowing more growth.

question: The first natural cytokinin was obtained from [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The first natural cytokinin was obtained from [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Letham isolated the first natural cytokinin, Zeatin, from unripe maize grains ($Zea$ $mays$).

question:
Match column I with column II and select the correct option. [2022]
Column I: A. Tryptophan, B. Mevalonic acid, C. Kinetin, D. Dormin
Column II: I. Cytokinins, II. Abscissic acid, III. Gibberellins, IV. Auxins
question_latex: Match column I with column II and select the correct option. [2022] \\ \textbf{Column I}: A. Tryptophan, B. Mevalonic acid, C. Kinetin, D. Dormin \\ \textbf{Column II}: I. Cytokinins, II. Abscissic acid, III. Gibberellins, IV. Auxins
options: A. A-III, B - II, C - I, D - IV
B. A-IV, B - III, C - I, D - II
C. A-I, B - III, C - IV, D - I
D. A-II, B - III, C - IV, D - I
answer: B. A-IV, B - III, C - I, D - II
solution: A-IV: Tryptophan is precursor of Auxin. B-III: Mevalonic acid is precursor of Gibberellin. C-I: Kinetin is a Cytokinin. D-II: Dormin is an old name for ABA.

question: Which enzyme is synthesized by Gibberellins to break seed dormancy in wheat and barley? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which enzyme is synthesized by Gibberellins to break seed dormancy in wheat and barley? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Gibberellins stimulate the production of $\alpha$-amylase in the aleurone layer of cereal seeds to hydrolyze starch into sugar.

question: Which hormones were discovered first in plants? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which hormones were discovered first in plants? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Auxins were the first group of phytohormones to be discovered and characterized in plants.

question: During nitrogen fixation the ammonia in the soil is converted into nitrate by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: During nitrogen fixation the ammonia in the soil is converted into nitrate by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Nitrification involves two steps: Ammonia to Nitrite ($Nitrosomonas$) and Nitrite to Nitrate ($Nitrobacter$).

question: Which hormone is responsible for apical growth?
question_latex: Which hormone is responsible for apical growth?
solution: Indole-3-Acetic Acid ($IAA$), an auxin, is primarily responsible for apical growth and the maintenance of apical dominance.

question: Gibberella fujikuroi which lead to discovery of hormone gibberllins is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: $Gibberella$ $fujikuroi$ which lead to discovery of hormone gibberllins is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The hormone gibberellin was first isolated from the soil fungus $Gibberella$ $fujikuroi$, which causes 'foolish seedling' disease in rice.

question:
Match the mineral deficiency disorders given in Column-I with their symptoms given in Column-II.
Column-I: (a) Chlorosis, (b) Necrosis, (c) Mottling, (d) Abscission.
Column-II: (I) Localized death of tissues, (II) Premature fall of leaves, (III) Yellowing of leaves, (IV) Green and non-green patches.
question_latex: Match the mineral deficiency disorders given in Column-I with their symptoms given in Column-II. \\ \textbf{Column-I}: (a) Chlorosis, (b) Necrosis, (c) Mottling, (d) Abscission. \\ \textbf{Column-II}: (I) Localized death of tissues, (II) Premature fall of leaves, (III) Yellowing of leaves, (IV) Green and non-green patches. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Chlorosis: Yellowing (III). Necrosis: Death of tissue (I). Mottling: Patches (IV). Abscission: Premature fall (II).

question: Day neutral plant relates to
question_latex: Day neutral plant relates to
options: A. Loss of activity during day time
C. Flowering in all possible photoperiods
D. No flowering in any photoperiod
answer: C. Flowering in all possible photoperiods
solution: Day Neutral Plants ($DNPs$) do not require a specific duration of light or dark to initiate flowering.

question: ........ is believed to be the site of vernalization in plants. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: ........ is believed to be the site of vernalization in plants. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The shoot apical meristem is the primary site that perceives the cold stimulus required for vernalization.

question: The most widely used compound as a source of ethylene is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The most widely used compound as a source of ethylene is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Ethephon (2-chloroethylphosphonic acid) is a commercial solution that releases ethylene once absorbed by plant tissues.

question: Indentify two of the following phytohormones, which regulate the stomatal movements? I.IAA II. III. Zeatin IV. ABA
question_latex: Indentify two of the following phytohormones, which regulate the stomatal movements? I. $IAA$ II. III. Zeatin IV. $ABA$
solution: Zeatin (Cytokinin) promotes stomatal opening, while Abscisic Acid ($ABA$) triggers stomatal closure during stress.

question: Natural cytokinins are synthesized in tissue that are
question_latex: Natural cytokinins are synthesized in tissue that are
solution: Cytokinins are produced in areas of rapid cell division, such as root tips, developing embryos, and young fruits.

question: Cell walls become brittle due to lack of
question_latex: Cell walls become brittle due to lack of
solution: Calcium ($Ca^{2+}$) in the form of calcium pectate makes up the middle lamella, providing structural integrity to cell walls.

question: Bakane disease of rice is caused by [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Bakane disease of rice is caused by [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The 'foolish seedling' disease is caused by the fungus $Gibberella$ $fujikuroi$.

question: Growth promoting hormone is
question_latex: Growth promoting hormone is
solution: Indole-3-Acetic Acid ($IAA$) is a classic growth-promoting hormone (Auxin).

question: Photoperiodism was first characterized in
question_latex: Photoperiodism was first characterized in
solution: Garner and Allard first described photoperiodism using the Maryland Mammoth variety of tobacco.

question: The phytohormone, which induces triple response growth is
question_latex: The phytohormone, which induces triple response growth is
solution: Ethylene ($C_{2}H_{4}$) induces the 'triple response' in seedlings: inhibition of stem elongation, thickening of the stem, and horizontal growth.

question: Pick out the correct statements. I. Cytokinins especially help in delaying senescence. II. Auxins are involved in regulating apical dominance. III. Ethylene is especially useful in enhancing seed germination. IV. Gibberellins are responsible for immature falling of leaves.
question_latex: Pick out the correct statements. I. Cytokinins especially help in delaying senescence. II. Auxins are involved in regulating apical dominance. III. Ethylene is especially useful in enhancing seed germination. IV. Gibberellins are responsible for immature falling of leaves.
solution: Cytokinins delay senescence (Richmond-Lang effect). Auxins maintain apical dominance. Ethylene promotes ripening/abscission. GAs promote elongation/germination.

question: In plants, auxins is synthesized in [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In plants, auxins is synthesized in [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Growing tips and meristematic regions
D. At the base of the plant organs
answer: A. Growing tips and meristematic regions
solution: Auxin is primarily synthesized in the shoot apex (tips) and other actively dividing meristematic tissues.

question: Based on the following statements choose the correct options given below: Statement I: Dormancy is a state of metabolic arrest that facilitates the survival of seeds during unfavourable conditions. Statement II: Mature and viable seeds do not germinate even in the presence of favourable conditions unless the dormancy period is completed. [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: Based on the following statements choose the correct options given below: Statement I: Dormancy is a state of metabolic arrest that facilitates the survival of seeds during unfavourable conditions. Statement II: Mature and viable seeds do not germinate even in the presence of favourable conditions unless the dormancy period is completed. [MHT-CET 2021]
options: A. Statement I is correct, Statement II is incorrect.
B. Both Statement I and II are incorrect.
C. Both Statement I and II are correct.
D. Statement I is incorrect, Statement II is correct.
answer: C. Both Statement I and II are correct.
solution: Both statements define true physiological seed dormancy, which is an adaptive trait for survival.

question: Select the INCORRECT statement about active absorption of minerals. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Select the INCORRECT statement about active absorption of minerals. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Poor supply of oxygen retards active absorption of minerals.
B. It requires expenditure of energy.
C. It takes place against a concentration gradient.
D. It is dependent on water absorption.
answer: D. It is dependent on water absorption.
solution: Mineral absorption is an independent physiological process and is not purely dependent on the rate of water absorption.

question: Which one of the following is NOT an extrinsic factor in the development of plants?
question_latex: Which one of the following is NOT an extrinsic factor in the development of plants?
solution: Hormones are intrinsic (internal) factors, while water, temperature, and oxygen are extrinsic (external) factors.

question: During nitrogen fixation in plants the nitrite is converted into nitrate by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: During nitrogen fixation in plants the nitrite is converted into nitrate by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: $Nitrobacter$ is the bacterium responsible for oxidizing nitrites ($NO_{2}^{-}$) into nitrates ($NO_{3}^{-}$).

question: In geometric growth, the total number of cells produced after four successive mitotic divisions will be [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: In geometric growth, the total number of cells produced after four successive mitotic divisions will be [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: In geometric growth, cell number doubles each generation: $2 \rightarrow 4 \rightarrow 8 \rightarrow 16$ ($2^{4}$).

question: Select the long day plant from the following: [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Select the long day plant from the following: [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Radish, Spinach, and Sugar beet are typical Long Day Plants ($LDPs$).

question: The deteriorative processes in plants that naturally terminate their functional life, are collectively called
question_latex: The deteriorative processes in plants that naturally terminate their functional life, are collectively called
solution: Senescence is the final stage of biological aging in plants or plant organs.

question: Which hormone is produced mostly in all parts of a plant?
question_latex: Which hormone is produced mostly in all parts of a plant?
solution: Ethylene is a gaseous hormone produced in almost all plant tissues, especially in ripening fruits and senescing tissues.

question: Given below are two statements with respect to nitrogen fixation. Statement I: Azospirillum is free living, aerobic nitrogen fixing bacterium associated with roots of corn, wheat and jowar. Statement II: It fixes considerable quantity of nitrogen in leguminous plants such as millets and oil seeds. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Given below are two statements with respect to nitrogen fixation. Statement I: $Azospirillum$ is free living, aerobic nitrogen fixing bacterium associated with roots of corn, wheat and jowar. Statement II: It fixes considerable quantity of nitrogen in leguminous plants such as millets and oil seeds. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: A. Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
B. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
C. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
D. Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
answer: D. Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
solution: $Azospirillum$ is an associative symbiotic bacterium for non-legumes like cereals, not primarily for leguminous plants.

question: While describing the dynamics of cell growth, the ratio of change the number of cells over the time interval is called [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: While describing the dynamics of cell growth, the ratio of change the number of cells over the time interval is called [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Absolute Growth Rate ($AGR$) is the total growth per unit time.

question: Which one of the following is INCORRECT about logistic growth model? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is INCORRECT about logistic growth model? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Only the fittest individuals will survive and reproduce in limited resources.
B. The rate of growth accelerates after initial log phase.
C. In nature, a given habitat has enough resources to support any number of species, but the growth is limited.
D. For animal populations, logistic growth model is considered a move realistic one
answer: C. In nature, a given habitat has enough resources to support any number of species, but the growth is limited.
solution: The logistic growth model assumes that resources are limited and defines a 'Carrying Capacity' ($K$), so it cannot support 'any' number of species infinitely.

question: Bolting in plant like beet and cabbage having rosette habits is promoted by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Bolting in plant like beet and cabbage having rosette habits is promoted by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Gibberellins induce sudden internodal elongation (bolting) prior to flowering in rosette plants.

question: The hormone present in the liquid endosperm of coconut is
question_latex: The hormone present in the liquid endosperm of coconut is
solution: Coconut milk is rich in cytokinins, which promote cell division.

question: 6-furfuryl amino purine, 2-4 dichlorophenoxy acetic acid and indole-3 acetic acid are examples respectively for
question_latex: 6-furfuryl amino purine, 2-4 dichlorophenoxy acetic acid and indole-3 acetic acid are examples respectively for
options: A. Synthetic auxin kinetin and natural auxin
B. Gibberellins, natural auxin and kinetin
C. Natural auxin, kinetin and synthetic auxin
D. Kinetin, synthetic auxin and natural auxin
answer: D. Kinetin, synthetic auxin and natural auxin
solution: Kinetin (synthetic/modified adenine), 2,4-D (synthetic auxin), and IAA (natural auxin).

question: Which one of the following is not an application of both Auxin and gibberellins? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which one of the following is not an application of both Auxin and gibberellins? [MHT-CET 2024]
options: B. Hastens early rooting in stems cuttings
C. Breaking of dormancy in seeds
answer: B. Hastens early rooting in stems cuttings
solution: Promoting rooting in cuttings is an application of auxins, but not typically of gibberellins (which might even inhibit it).

question: The chemical nature of gibberellins is
question_latex: The chemical nature of gibberellins is
solution: All gibberellins are acids (hence $GA_{1}$, $GA_{2}$, etc., for Gibberellic Acid).

question: Which one of the following growth regulator has a role in enlargement of ovary into fruit in parthenocarpy? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which one of the following growth regulator has a role in enlargement of ovary into fruit in parthenocarpy? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Auxins like $IAA$ induce parthenocarpy (seedless fruit formation) in plants like tomatoes.

question: The bioassay of auxin is
question_latex: The bioassay of auxin is
solution: The Avena (oat) coleoptile curvature test is the standard bioassay for auxin activity.

question: Phytohormone commonly called stress hormone is
question_latex: Phytohormone commonly called stress hormone is
solution: $ABA$ is called the stress hormone because it mediates plant responses to abiotic stresses like drought and cold.

question: Micropropagation is done by
question_latex: Micropropagation is done by
solution: Successful tissue culture/micropropagation relies on a precise balance between Auxins and Cytokinins for morphogenesis.

question: The hormone involved in metabolism of food material in cereal grains during germination is
question_latex: The hormone involved in metabolism of food material in cereal grains during germination is
solution: Gibberellins trigger the synthesis of hydrolytic enzymes to mobilize food reserves in the endosperm.

question: The direction of growth of shoot and root in plants is decided by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The direction of growth of shoot and root in plants is decided by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Geotropism (gravitropism) is the growth response to gravity, making shoots grow upward and roots grow downward.

question: Deficiency of causes death of shoot and root tips in plants.
question_latex: Deficiency of causes death of shoot and root tips in plants.
solution: Boron is essential for apical meristem activity; its deficiency leads to the death of growing tips.

question: Which of the following factors generally determine the plant species in the environment? (I) Sunlight (II) Rainfall (III) Temperature (IV) Soil types (V) Mammals Choose the correct option [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following factors generally determine the plant species in the environment? (I) Sunlight (II) Rainfall (III) Temperature (IV) Soil types (V) Mammals Choose the correct option [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Abiotic factors like light, water, temperature, and soil are the primary determinants of plant distribution. Mammals are biotic components.

question: What helps in flowering?
question_latex: What helps in flowering?
solution: Phytochromes perceive photoperiodic signals and regulate the transition to the flowering stage.

question: Which one of the following phytohormones is involved in the synthesis of a plant IAA and vasoconstrides cerotonin?
question_latex: Which one of the following phytohormones is involved in the synthesis of a plant $IAA$ and vasoconstrides cerotonin?
solution: Wait, the question asks about a hormone group. Cytokinins are involved in many biosynthetic pathways. (Note: Check context if it refers to specific precursors like amino acids).

question: Which of the following in incorrectly matched?
question_latex: Which of the following in incorrectly matched?
options: A. Explant- Excised plant part used for callus formation
B. Cytokinins- Root initiation in callus
C. Somatic embryo- Embryo produced from a vegetative cell
answer: B. Cytokinins- Root initiation in callus
solution: Root initiation in callus is typically promoted by Auxins, while Cytokinins promote shoot initiation.

question: Apical dominance is caused by
question_latex: Apical dominance is caused by
solution: Apical dominance is the suppression of lateral bud growth by auxins produced in the apical meristem.

question: IAA is derived from or which of the following is involved in the synthesis of a plant IAA and vasoconstrides cerotonin?
question_latex: $IAA$ is derived from or which of the following is involved in the synthesis of a plant $IAA$ and vasoconstrides cerotonin?
solution: The amino acid Tryptophan is the primary precursor for the synthesis of $IAA$ in plants and serotonin in animals.

question: Gibberellin was first extracted from [MHT-CET 2019]
question_latex: Gibberellin was first extracted from [MHT-CET 2019]
solution: Gibberellins were discovered during studies on the fungus $Gibberella$ $fujikuroi$.

question: Process of vernalization can be induced by
question_latex: Process of vernalization can be induced by
solution: Application of Gibberellic Acid ($GA$) can substitute for the cold treatment requirement of some plants to induce flowering.

question: Phototropic curvature is the result of uneen Distribution of
question_latex: Phototropic curvature is the result of uneen Distribution of
solution: Uneven distribution of auxin (accumulating on the shaded side) causes differential cell elongation, resulting in phototropic bending.

question: Atul had 4 seeds with him and wanted to know which one of the following will show the cotyledons outside of the soil after germination?
question_latex: Atul had 4 seeds with him and wanted to know which one of the following will show the cotyledons outside of the soil after germination?
solution: Epigeal germination is seen in Castor, where the hypocotyl elongates and pushes the cotyledons above the soil.

question: Programmed cell death is scientifically termed as [MHT CET 2009]
question_latex: Programmed cell death is scientifically termed as [MHT CET 2009]
solution: Apoptosis is the programmed sequence of events leading to cell death, essential for development and defense.

question: How much percentage of water is utilized for cell expansion and plant growth? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: How much percentage of water is utilized for cell expansion and plant growth? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Only about $5\%$ (or less, often cited as $1-5\%$) of the total water absorbed by roots is actually used for growth and metabolism; the rest is transpired.

question: Auxin originates at the tip of the stem and controls growth elsewhere. The movement of auxin is largely
question_latex: Auxin originates at the tip of the stem and controls growth elsewhere. The movement of auxin is largely
solution: Auxin transport is polar: basipetal (apex to base) in stems and acropetal (base to apex) in roots.

question: Match the terms given in Column I with examples of tissues given in Column II. Column I: (a) Differentiation, (b) Dedifferentiation, (c) Redifferentiation. Column II: (I) Interfascicular cambium and cork cambium, (II) Secondary xylem and secondary phloem, (III) developed from interfascicular cambium hydrophyy give buoyancy. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match the terms given in Column I with examples of tissues given in Column II. \\ \textbf{Column I}: (a) Differentiation, (b) Dedifferentiation, (c) Redifferentiation. \\ \textbf{Column II}: (I) Interfascicular cambium and cork cambium, (II) Secondary xylem and secondary phloem, (III) developed from interfascicular cambium hydrophyy give buoyancy. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Differentiation (a-III): cells becoming specialized. Dedifferentiation (b-I): differentiated cells becoming meristematic. Redifferentiation (c-II): secondary tissues from meristems.

question: To make stored food available for germination, with which hormone seed should be treated?
question_latex: To make stored food available for germination, with which hormone seed should be treated?
solution: Gibberellins are the primary hormones responsible for mobilizing food reserves during germination.

question: Which hormone induces RNA synthesis? [2022]
question_latex: Which hormone induces RNA synthesis? [2022]
solution: Cytokinins are known to stimulate the synthesis of $RNA$ and proteins, delaying leaf senescence.

question: Which auxin was discovered first? [2022]
question_latex: Which auxin was discovered first? [2022]
solution: Indole-3-Acetic Acid ($IAA$) was the first naturally occurring auxin discovered.

question: Which auxin should be used to eradicate dicotyledonous weeds from a monocotyledonous crop field?
question_latex: Which auxin should be used to eradicate dicotyledonous weeds from a monocotyledonous crop field?
solution: 2,4-D is a selective herbicide that kills broad-leaved dicots but does not affect monocot crops like wheat or maize.

question: One of the synthetic auxin is
question_latex: One of the synthetic auxin is
solution: Naphthalene Acetic Acid ($NAA$) is a widely used synthetic auxin.

question: Which of the following is a day neutral plant?
question_latex: Which of the following is a day neutral plant?
solution: Sunflower ($Helianthus$ $annuus$) and Tomato are examples of Day Neutral Plants.

question: Which plant hormone prevents pre-mature fruit drop in apple, pear and orange? [2022]
question_latex: Which plant hormone prevents pre-mature fruit drop in apple, pear and orange? [2022]
solution: Application of low concentrations of auxins prevents the premature formation of the abscission layer in fruits.

question: The maximum growth rate occurs in
question_latex: The maximum growth rate occurs in
solution: The exponential or log phase is the period of most rapid growth.

question: In the given equation showing Haber-Bosch industrial nitrogen fixing process, 'x' stands for N2 + 3H2 -> 2NH3 [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: $N_{2} + 3H_{2} \xrightarrow{x, 200\text{ atm}}$ $2NH_{3}$. In the given equation, 'x' stands for [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The industrial Haber-Bosch process operates at a temperature around $450^{\circ}C$.

question: The problem of necrosis and gradual senescence, while performing tissue culture can be overcome by
question_latex: The problem of necrosis and gradual senescence, while performing tissue culture can be overcome by
solution: Cytokinins delay senescence and maintain the green health of tissues in culture.

question: Vernalization increases the resistance of plants for diseases caused by
question_latex: Vernalization increases the resistance of plants for diseases caused by
solution: Vernalization has been observed to improve resistance to certain fungal pathogens in some crop varieties.

question: Growth plotted against time gives a
question_latex: Growth plotted against time gives a
solution: A typical growth curve follows an S-shaped or sigmoid pattern over the lifespan of an organism.

question: Plant hormones are transported through [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Plant hormones are transported through [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Hormones like auxins and carbohydrates are transported through the living cells of the phloem.

question: Given below are the two statements. Statement I: The deficiency symptoms of minerals appear in young tissues when elements are relatively immobile within the plants. Statement II: The deficiency symptoms of minerals appear first in the older tissues when elements are actively mobilized. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are the two statements. Statement I: The deficiency symptoms of minerals appear in young tissues when elements are relatively immobile within the plants. Statement II: The deficiency symptoms of minerals appear first in the older tissues when elements are actively mobilized. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
B. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
C. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
D. Statement I is correct but statement II is correct.
answer: C. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: Both statements correctly describe the appearance of deficiency symptoms based on element mobility (e.g., $Ca$ is immobile, $N$, $P$, $K$ are mobile).

question: Application of which hormone is useful to produce male flowers on female plant? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Application of which hormone is useful to produce male flowers on female plant? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Gibberellins are known to promote maleness in certain dioecious species.

question: Genetically dwarf plants can be induced to grow tall by using
question_latex: Genetically dwarf plants can be induced to grow tall by using
solution: Gibberellins can overcome genetic dwarfism by stimulating internodal elongation.

question: Which one of the following acids is a derivative of carotenoids?
question_latex: Which one of the following acids is a derivative of carotenoids?
solution: Abscisic acid ($ABA$) is synthesized from carotenoid precursors.

question: Abscissic acid acts as anti-transpirant by the following process except [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Abscissic acid acts as anti-transpirant by the following process except [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Prevents uptake of $K^{+}$ by guard cells during night
B. Making the guard cells hypotonic
C. Making the guard cells turgid
D. Efflux of $K^{+}$ from guard cells during daytime
answer: C. Making the guard cells turgid
solution: Anti-transpirants like $ABA$ make guard cells flaccid (by solute efflux) to close the stomata; they do not make them turgid.

question: Match elements given in Column I with their deficiency symptoms shown by plants given in Column II. Column I: (a) Chlorine, (b) Boron, (c) Zinc, (d) Copper. Column II: (i) Brown heart disease, (ii) Malformed leaves, (iii) Poor growth of the plant, (iv) Die-back of shoots. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Match elements given in Column I with their deficiency symptoms shown by plants given in Column II. \\ \textbf{Column I}: (a) Chlorine, (b) Boron, (c) Zinc, (d) Copper. \\ \textbf{Column II}: (i) Brown heart disease, (ii) Malformed leaves, (iii) Poor growth of the plant, (iv) Die-back of shoots. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Chlorine: Poor growth (iii). Boron: Brown heart (i). Zinc: Malformed leaves (ii). Copper: Die-back (iv).

question: The first step in plant growth is
question_latex: The first step in plant growth is
solution: The actual visible initiation of plant growth begins with seed germination.

question: Given below are the two statements. Statement-I: Auxins promote root elongation in low concentration and shoot development in higher concentration. Statement-II: A low ratio of cytokinin to auxin induces root development but a high ratio causes shoot development. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Given below are the two statements. Statement-I: Auxins promote root elongation in low concentration and shoot development in higher concentration. Statement-II: A low ratio of cytokinin to auxin induces root development but a high ratio causes shoot development. [MHT-CET 2024]
options: A. Statement I is incorrect but statement II is correct.
B. Both statement I and statement II are incorrect.
C. Statement I is correct but statement II is incorrect.
D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
answer: D. Both statement I and statement II are correct.
solution: Statement I is a fundamental observation of auxin physiology. Statement II describes the Skoog and Miller experiment on morphogenesis.

question: The optimum range of temperature for plant growth is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The optimum range of temperature for plant growth is [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Most plants grow best within a temperature range of $25^{\circ}C$ to $35^{\circ}C$.

question: Auxin causes
question_latex: Auxin causes
solution: Auxin promotes the growth of the apical bud while inhibiting the lateral buds (apical dominance).

question: Which of the following processes is concerned with Cholodny-Went theory?
question_latex: Which of the following processes is concerned with Cholodny-Went theory?
solution: The Cholodny-Went theory explains phototropism by stating that unilateral light causes an unequal distribution of auxin ($IAA$), with higher concentrations on the shaded side leading to differential growth and bending.

question: Application of which hormone causes production of male flowers on female plants? [2022]
question_latex: Application of which hormone causes production of male flowers on female plants? [2022]
solution: Gibberellins are known to induce the formation of male flowers in certain dioecious species like $Cannabis$, effectively altering the sex expression of the plant.

question: Which plant hormone is associated with discovery of bakane disease caused by fungus? [2022]
question_latex: Which plant hormone is associated with discovery of bakane disease caused by fungus? [2022]
solution: Gibberellins were discovered through the study of 'Bakane' or 'foolish seedling' disease in rice, caused by the fungus $Gibberella$ $fujikuroi$.

question: Substance related with phototropism in shoot, is
question_latex: Substance related with phototropism in shoot, is
solution: Auxin ($IAA$) is the primary hormone responsible for phototropic responses in shoots by regulating cell elongation on the shaded side.

question: Phytohormone which can replace the requirement of vernalization in some plants is
question_latex: Phytohormone which can replace the requirement of vernalization in some plants is
solution: In many plants, exogenous application of gibberellins can bypass the need for cold treatment (vernalization) to trigger flowering.

question: High concentration of auxin in apical bud inhibits the growth of lateral buds. This is called [MHT-CET 2021]
question_latex: High concentration of auxin in apical bud inhibits the growth of lateral buds. This is called [MHT-CET 2021]
solution: Apical dominance is the phenomenon where the growth of the apical meristem suppresses the development of lateral or axillary buds.

question: Which of the following is a gaseous phytohormone?
question_latex: Which of the following is a gaseous phytohormone?
solution: Ethylene ($C_{2}H_{4}$) is the only naturally occurring gaseous plant growth regulator.

question: Synthetic auxin 2,4-D is widely used as a [MHT-CET 2020]
question_latex: Synthetic auxin $2,4-D$ is widely used as a [MHT-CET 2020]
solution: 2,4-Dichlorophenoxyacetic acid ($2,4-D$) is a synthetic auxin that acts as a selective herbicide, killing broad-leaved dicot weeds.

question: Richmond-Lang effect is associated with which hormone?
question_latex: Richmond-Lang effect is associated with which hormone?
solution: The Richmond-Lang effect refers to the delay of leaf senescence by the application of cytokinins.

question: Which hormone promotes the closure of stomata during water stress? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which hormone promotes the closure of stomata during water stress? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Abscisic Acid ($ABA$) acts as a stress hormone by triggering the closure of stomata to prevent excessive water loss during drought conditions.

question: Triple response in seedlings is characteristic of which hormone?
question_latex: Triple response in seedlings is characteristic of which hormone?
solution: Ethylene induces a 'triple response' in pea seedlings: inhibition of stem elongation, thickening of the stem, and horizontal growth (diageotropism).

question: Parthenocarpy in grapes is induced by
question_latex: Parthenocarpy in grapes is induced by
solution: Gibberellins are effectively used to induce parthenocarpy (seedless fruit) and increase the fruit size in varieties of grapes.

question: Natural cytokinins are derived from
question_latex: Natural cytokinins are derived from
solution: Cytokinins are nitrogenous growth regulators that are structurally related to the purine base adenine.

question: Which mineral is required for the synthesis of chlorophyll?
question_latex: Which mineral is required for the synthesis of chlorophyll?
solution: Magnesium ($Mg^{2+}$) is the central atom of the chlorophyll molecule, and Iron ($Fe^{2+}$) is essential for the enzymes involved in its synthesis.

question: The precursor of ethylene is
question_latex: The precursor of ethylene is
solution: The amino acid methionine is the starting material for the biosynthesis of ethylene in plants.

question: Formation of callus in tissue culture is promoted by
question_latex: Formation of callus in tissue culture is promoted by
solution: A balance of auxin (like $IAA$) and cytokinins is required to induce cell division and callus formation in explants.

question: Deficiency of which element causes interveinal chlorosis in older leaves?
question_latex: Deficiency of which element causes interveinal chlorosis in older leaves?
solution: Magnesium is a mobile element; when deficient, it is transported from older to younger leaves, causing chlorosis between the veins of older leaves first.

question: Photoperiodic stimulus is perceived by [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Photoperiodic stimulus is perceived by [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: The leaves are the primary organs that perceive the duration of light and dark, which then transmit the stimulus to the shoot apex.

question: Vernalin is a hypothetical hormone produced during
question_latex: Vernalin is a hypothetical hormone produced during
solution: Vernalin is the name given to the hypothetical floral stimulus produced in plants following exposure to low temperatures.

question: Which of the following is an anti-transpirant?
question_latex: Which of the following is an anti-transpirant?
solution: Abscisic Acid ($ABA$) reduces transpiration by inducing stomatal closure, helping the plant conserve water during stress.

question: Identify the CORRECT match. (a) Long day plant - Spinach, (b) Short day plant - Xanthium, (c) Day neutral plant - Cotton. [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Identify the CORRECT match. (a) Long day plant - Spinach, (b) Short day plant - Xanthium, (c) Day neutral plant - Cotton. [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Spinach is a Long Day Plant, Xanthium is a Short Day Plant, and Cotton is a Day Neutral Plant.

question: Abscission of leaves and fruits is promoted by
question_latex: Abscission of leaves and fruits is promoted by
solution: Ethylene and Abscisic acid stimulate the formation of the abscission layer, leading to the shedding of organs.

question: Malting process in brewing industry is accelerated by
question_latex: Malting process in brewing industry is accelerated by
solution: Gibberellic acid ($GA_{3}$) stimulates the production of $\alpha$-amylase, which speeds up the malting process in barley.

question: Which of the following is NOT a micronutrient for plants? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is NOT a micronutrient for plants? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Magnesium is a macronutrient, as it is required by plants in relatively large quantities.

question: Auxin transport in plants is
question_latex: Auxin transport in plants is
solution: Auxin movement is polar, meaning it moves in a specific direction (basipetal in stems and acropetal in roots).

question: Which of the following conditions is required for vernalization? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following conditions is required for vernalization? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Successful vernalization requires low temperature, moisture for metabolic activity, and aerobic conditions for respiration.

question: The site of perception of light in photoperiodism is the [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The site of perception of light in photoperiodism is the [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Leaves contain phytochromes that perceive the light/dark ratio and initiate the signal for flowering.

question: Premature fall of fruits can be prevented by spraying
question_latex: Premature fall of fruits can be prevented by spraying
solution: Auxins (natural or synthetic) inhibit the formation of the abscission layer at the base of the pedicel.

question: Which of the following is a symptom of nitrogen deficiency?
question_latex: Which of the following is a symptom of nitrogen deficiency?
solution: Nitrogen deficiency leads to reduced protein synthesis, chlorosis, anthocyanin (purple) pigments, and overall stunted growth.

question: The primary role of cytokinins is to
question_latex: The primary role of cytokinins is to
solution: As the name suggests, cytokinins are primarily involved in cytokinesis (cell division).

question: Which hormone is used to speed up the ripening of fruits after harvest? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which hormone is used to speed up the ripening of fruits after harvest? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Ethylene is the 'ripening hormone'; its gaseous nature allows it to be applied to fruits in storage to trigger ripening.

question: Dormancy in seeds can be broken by using
question_latex: Dormancy in seeds can be broken by using
solution: Seed dormancy can be overcome physically (cold/stratification), hormonally (GA), or chemically (nitrates).

question: Which one of the following minerals is a component of Nitrogenase enzyme?
question_latex: Which one of the following minerals is a component of Nitrogenase enzyme?
solution: The enzyme Nitrogenase, responsible for biological nitrogen fixation, contains an Iron-Molybdenum ($Fe-Mo$) protein complex.

question: Formation of fruit without fertilization is called
question_latex: Formation of fruit without fertilization is called
solution: Parthenocarpy is the development of fruit from an unfertilized ovary, often resulting in seedless fruits.

question: The hormone involved in promoting the formation of root hairs is
question_latex: The hormone involved in promoting the formation of root hairs is
solution: Ethylene is known to stimulate root hair formation, increasing the surface area for water absorption.

question: Avena curvature test is used for the bioassay of [MHT-CET 2018]
question_latex: Avena curvature test is used for the bioassay of [MHT-CET 2018]
solution: The Avena (oat) curvature test, developed by Went, is the quantitative bioassay for auxins ($IAA$).

question: In plants, cell division is mainly controlled by
question_latex: In plants, cell division is mainly controlled by
solution: Cytokinins promote cytokinesis and are essential for the maintenance of meristematic activity.

question: The process of nitrogen fixation converts atmospheric nitrogen ($N_{2}$) into [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: The process of nitrogen fixation converts atmospheric nitrogen ($N_{2}$) into [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Biological nitrogen fixation is the reduction of atmospheric nitrogen ($N_{2}$) to ammonia ($NH_{3}$).

question: Phytochrome exists in two forms, which are
question_latex: Phytochrome exists in two forms, which are
solution: Phytochrome is a photo-reversible pigment that exists in $P_{r}$ (inactive, absorbs red light) and $P_{fr}$ (active, absorbs far-red light) forms.

question: Which of the following is a synthetic cytokinin?
question_latex: Which of the following is a synthetic cytokinin?
solution: Kinetin (from herring sperm DNA) and BAP are widely used synthetic cytokinins.

question: Removal of shoot tips promotes growth of lateral buds due to decrease in [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Removal of shoot tips promotes growth of lateral buds due to decrease in [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Decapitation removes the source of auxin, thereby breaking apical dominance and allowing axillary buds to develop.

question: Which hormone is used to increase the stalk length of grapes?
question_latex: Which hormone is used to increase the stalk length of grapes?
solution: Gibberellins are used in viticulture to increase the length of the fruit stalks, which provides more space for berry growth.

question: During nitrate assimilation in plants, nitrate is reduced to ammonia by the enzymes
question_latex: During nitrate assimilation in plants, nitrate is reduced to ammonia by the enzymes
solution: Nitrate assimilation involves the sequential reduction: $NO_{3}^{-} \rightarrow NO_{2}^{-}$ (Nitrate reductase) and $NO_{2}^{-} \rightarrow NH_{3}$ (Nitrite reductase).

question: Which of the following is a 'foolish seedling' hormone?
question_latex: Which of the following is a 'foolish seedling' hormone?
solution: Gibberellin causes the excessive elongation characteristic of the 'Bakane' or foolish seedling disease.

question: Hormone that acts as an antagonist to gibberellins regarding seed germination is
question_latex: Hormone that acts as an antagonist to gibberellins regarding seed germination is
solution: While gibberellins promote germination, Abscisic acid ($ABA$) inhibits it and maintains seed dormancy.

question: The active form of phytochrome that induces flowering in long day plants is
question_latex: The active form of phytochrome that induces flowering in long day plants is
solution: $P_{fr}$ (the far-red absorbing form) is the biologically active form that accumulates in light and triggers flowering responses.

question: Which mineral is a component of the middle lamella?
question_latex: Which mineral is a component of the middle lamella?
solution: The middle lamella is primarily composed of calcium and magnesium pectates.

question: Fruit ripening is inhibited by
question_latex: Fruit ripening is inhibited by
solution: Storage in high $CO_{2}$ and low temperatures (refrigeration) slows down the ripening process by inhibiting ethylene action.

question: The element essential for the translocation of sugars is
question_latex: The element essential for the translocation of sugars is
solution: Boron is vital for the movement of sugars across cell membranes and their translocation in phloem.

question: Which of the following hormones is used to induce root formation in stem cuttings? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following hormones is used to induce root formation in stem cuttings? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Indole-3-butyric acid ($IBA$) and Naphthalene acetic acid ($NAA$) are synthetic auxins commonly used as rooting powders.

question: Auxin stimulates the growth of
question_latex: Auxin stimulates the growth of
solution: Shoots require a much higher concentration of auxin for stimulation than roots; high concentrations that stimulate shoots often inhibit root growth.

question: Cytokinins help to overcome
question_latex: Cytokinins help to overcome
solution: Cytokinins antagonize auxins to promote lateral bud growth and can also help break seed dormancy in certain species.

question: The major function of manganese in plants is [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: The major function of manganese in plants is [MHT-CET 2023]
options: B. Photolysis of water in photosynthesis
answer: B. Photolysis of water in photosynthesis
solution: Manganese ($Mn^{2+}$) is the primary component of the oxygen-evolving complex ($OEC$) responsible for splitting water during the light reactions.

question: Natural gibberellin GA3 is chemically
question_latex: Natural gibberellin $GA_{3}$ is chemically
solution: $GA_{3}$ is the most common and standard form of gibberellic acid used in research and agriculture.

question: Which of the following is a nitrogen-fixing cyanobacterium?
question_latex: Which of the following is a nitrogen-fixing cyanobacterium?
solution: $Anabaena$, $Nostoc$, and $Aulosira$ are all nitrogen-fixing cyanobacteria that possess specialized cells called heterocysts.

question: What is the effect of red light on phytochrome?
question_latex: What is the effect of red light on phytochrome?
solution: Absorption of red light ($660$ nm) converts the inactive $P_{r}$ form into the biologically active $P_{fr}$ form.

question: The condition caused by the deficiency of iron is
question_latex: The condition caused by the deficiency of iron is
solution: Iron is immobile; therefore, deficiency symptoms (chlorosis) appear first in young leaves.

question: Which hormone inhibits the germination of seeds even under favorable conditions? [2022]
question_latex: Which hormone inhibits the germination of seeds even under favorable conditions? [2022]
solution: Abscisic acid maintains seed dormancy by inhibiting the synthesis of enzymes required for germination.

question: Kinetin was first discovered by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Kinetin was first discovered by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Skoog and Miller (1955) discovered Kinetin while working on tobacco pith tissue culture.

question: The element that helps in the synthesis of auxin is
question_latex: The element that helps in the synthesis of auxin is
solution: Zinc ($Zn^{2+}$) is an essential cofactor for the enzymes involved in the synthesis of tryptophan, the precursor of $IAA$.

question: Which of the following is a synthetic auxin used to induce flowering in pineapple?
question_latex: Which of the following is a synthetic auxin used to induce flowering in pineapple?
solution: $NAA$ (Naphthalene acetic acid) is used commercially to synchronize flowering and fruit set in pineapples.

question: Phototropism in shoots is a result of
question_latex: Phototropism in shoots is a result of
options: A. Increased growth on the illuminated side
B. Increased growth on the shaded side
C. Decreased growth on both sides
answer: B. Increased growth on the shaded side
solution: Auxin accumulation on the shaded side stimulates faster cell elongation, causing the shoot to bend toward the light.

question: Which Element is associated with the conversion of atmospheric N2 to ammonia in root nodules? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which Element is associated with the conversion of atmospheric $N_{2}$ to ammonia in root nodules? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Molybdenum is a crucial cofactor for the nitrogenase enzyme system in nitrogen-fixing bacteria.

question: Bolting is often associated with which habit?
question_latex: Bolting is often associated with which habit?
solution: Rosette plants have very short internodes; bolting is the rapid elongation of these internodes prior to flowering.

question: Which hormone is a derivative of terpenes?
question_latex: Which hormone is a derivative of terpenes?
solution: Gibberellins are chemically classified as tetracyclic diterpenes.

question: The phenomenon of flowering in response to the duration of light and dark is
question_latex: The phenomenon of flowering in response to the duration of light and dark is
solution: Photoperiodism is the developmental response of plants to the relative lengths of day and night.

question: The precursor for the synthesis of Abscisic acid is
question_latex: The precursor for the synthesis of Abscisic acid is
solution: $ABA$ is synthesized from carotenoids like violaxanthin through the xanthoxin pathway.

question: Which elements are part of the 'Nitrogen cycle'? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which elements are part of the 'Nitrogen cycle'? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The nitrogen cycle includes fixation, ammonification, nitrification, and denitrification.

question: What is the function of leghaemoglobin in root nodules? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: What is the function of leghaemoglobin in root nodules? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Leghaemoglobin binds to free oxygen to create an anaerobic environment within the nodule, protecting the oxygen-sensitive nitrogenase enzyme.

question: Delayed senescence in plants can be achieved by applying
question_latex: Delayed senescence in plants can be achieved by applying
solution: Cytokinins delay senescence by promoting nutrient mobilization and maintaining chlorophyll levels.

question: Which hormone is used to promote maleness in cucumber plants?
question_latex: Which hormone is used to promote maleness in cucumber plants?
solution: Gibberellins are often used to increase the proportion of staminate (male) flowers in cucurbits.

question: The phenomenon of apical dominance can be overcome by applying
question_latex: The phenomenon of apical dominance can be overcome by applying
solution: Cytokinins promote the growth of lateral buds, effectively counteracting the inhibitory effect of auxin from the apex.

question: Which of the following is a day neutral plant? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which of the following is a day neutral plant? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Tomato and Sunflower are well-known examples of day neutral plants that flower regardless of the photoperiod.

question: Whiptail disease in cauliflower is due to the deficiency of
question_latex: Whiptail disease in cauliflower is due to the deficiency of
solution: Molybdenum deficiency in cauliflower results in the reduction of leaf blades, leaving only the midrib, a condition called whiptail.

question: Which hormone is used to inhibit the sprouting of potato tubers during storage?
question_latex: Which hormone is used to inhibit the sprouting of potato tubers during storage?
solution: Synthetic auxins like $NAA$ and inhibitors like Maleic hydrazide are used to prevent sprouting and extend the shelf life of tubers.

question: The conversion of amino acids into ammonia by soil microbes is called
question_latex: The conversion of amino acids into ammonia by soil microbes is called
solution: Ammonification is the decomposition of organic nitrogenous matter (like proteins/amino acids) into ammonia by ammonifying bacteria.

question: Which form of phytochrome absorbs far-red light? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which form of phytochrome absorbs far-red light? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: $P_{fr}$ (Phytochrome far-red) absorbs light at $730$ nm and is converted back to the $P_{r}$ form.

question: Which of the following elements is mobile in plants?
question_latex: Which of the following elements is mobile in plants?
solution: Potassium, Nitrogen, and Phosphorus are highly mobile elements and can be moved from older to younger tissues.

question: Gibberellins were first isolated from a fungus by [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Gibberellins were first isolated from a fungus by [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Yabuta and Sumiki (1938) isolated the active crystalline substance from $Gibberella$ $fujikuroi$ and named it Gibberellin.

question: Parthenocarpy in tomatoes can be induced by
question_latex: Parthenocarpy in tomatoes can be induced by
solution: Auxins are primarily used to induce seedless fruit formation in tomato plants.

question: The movement of water-soluble minerals into the root xylem is primarily
question_latex: The movement of water-soluble minerals into the root xylem is primarily
solution: Mineral uptake involves both passive diffusion (apoplast) and active transport (symplast) across membranes.

question: Which hormone promotes the growth of the pollen tube?
question_latex: Which hormone promotes the growth of the pollen tube?
solution: Gibberellins are involved in promoting the growth and development of the pollen tube during fertilization.

question: Identification of 'S-shaped' growth curve is possible during
question_latex: Identification of 'S-shaped' growth curve is possible during
solution: Geometric growth patterns, common in living organisms, result in a sigmoid or S-shaped curve when plotted against time.

question: The major form of nitrogen absorbed from the soil by plants is
question_latex: The major form of nitrogen absorbed from the soil by plants is
solution: Although plants can absorb ammonia, they primarily take up nitrogen in the form of nitrates ($NO_{3}^{-}$).

question: The term 'Auxin' was coined by
question_latex: The term 'Auxin' was coined by
solution: F.W. Went (1928) isolated the substance from oat coleoptiles and coined the term 'auxin' (from the Greek 'auxein', to grow).

question: In roots, auxin concentration required for stimulation is
question_latex: In roots, auxin concentration required for stimulation is
solution: Roots are highly sensitive to auxin; they are stimulated by very low concentrations and inhibited by concentrations that would stimulate shoots.

question: Which element is involved in the opening and closing of stomata? [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: Which element is involved in the opening and closing of stomata? [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: The movement of $K^{+}$ ions into and out of guard cells regulates their turgidity and the stomatal aperture.

question: Commercial preparation of auxin used to eradicate dicot weeds is
question_latex: Commercial preparation of auxin used to eradicate dicot weeds is
solution: 2,4-D is a potent synthetic auxin used as a selective weedicide in agriculture.

question: Which hormone promotes the germination of seeds in cereals by synthesizing amylase?
question_latex: Which hormone promotes the germination of seeds in cereals by synthesizing amylase?
solution: Gibberellins induce the de novo synthesis of $\alpha$-amylase to mobilize nutrients in germinating cereal seeds.

question: The primary cause of chlorosis is the deficiency of
question_latex: The primary cause of chlorosis is the deficiency of
solution: Chlorosis (loss of chlorophyll) can be caused by the lack of several essential elements, including $N$, $Mg$, and $Fe$.

question: Which of the following is an intrinsic factor affecting plant growth?
question_latex: Which of the following is an intrinsic factor affecting plant growth?
solution: Phytohormones are internal (intrinsic) genetic and chemical factors that regulate growth.

question: During nitrogen fixation, the conversion of ammonia to nitrite is done by
question_latex: During nitrogen fixation, the conversion of ammonia to nitrite is done by
solution: $Nitrosomonas$ and $Nitrosococcus$ oxidize ammonia into nitrites ($NO_{2}^{-}$).

question: The active form of phytochrome Pfr is converted into Pr by
question_latex: The active form of phytochrome $P_{fr}$ is converted into $P_{r}$ by
solution: Absorption of far-red light ($730$ nm) converts the active $P_{fr}$ form back to the inactive $P_{r}$ form.

question: Which element is a component of Vitamin B12? [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Which element is a component of Vitamin $B_{12}$? [MHT-CET 2023]
solution: Cobalt ($Co$) is the central metallic element of cobalamin (Vitamin $B_{12}$).

question: Application of cytokinins on leaves produces
question_latex: Application of cytokinins on leaves produces
solution: Cytokinins keep the leaves green and metabolically active for a longer period.

question: Which elements are required in 'trace' amounts by plants?
question_latex: Which elements are required in 'trace' amounts by plants?
solution: Micronutrients (like $Fe, Mn, Zn, Cu, Mo, B, Cl, Ni$) are needed in very small or trace quantities.

question: The phenomenon where plants flower only when exposed to low temperatures is
question_latex: The phenomenon where plants flower only when exposed to low temperatures is
solution: Vernalization is the promotion of flowering by a period of low temperature.

question: Little leaf disease of brinjal is due to the deficiency of
question_latex: Little leaf disease of brinjal is due to the deficiency of
solution: Zinc deficiency causes 'little leaf' disease, characterized by reduced leaf size and stunted growth.

question: Select the correct statements from the following regarding gaseous exchange in plants. (i) A terrestrial plant has many air spaces between the cells of leaf and root. (iii) In aerated soil, oxygen dissolved in water enters root tissue by diffusion. [MHT-CET 2023]
question_latex: Select the correct statements from the following regarding gaseous exchange in plants. (i) A terrestrial plant has many air spaces between the cells of leaf and root. (iii) In aerated soil, oxygen dissolved in water enters root tissue by diffusion. [MHT-CET 2023]
options: B. II, III and IV only
solution: Plants have extensive air spaces for gas diffusion, and oxygen enters roots from the soil solution by simple diffusion.

question: A natural plant hormone is [MHT-CET 2024]
question_latex: A natural plant hormone is [MHT-CET 2024]
solution: Indole-3-Acetic Acid ($IAA$) is the most widely distributed natural auxin in plants.
